Hi!
We’re designing a new blog and one of the things we want to add is ‘content parts’, which we imagine would be premade modules like one on the screenshot below. Is it possible to add those modules to blog posts when creating posts? I don’t seem to find any interface that would allow me to do that. Actually, I can’t even add a ‘Flexible column’ to a ‘Blog template’, which I could do for normal ‘Page template’.
I don’t know if this is appropriate channel for that kind of question, I don’t see a ‘blog’ dedicated channel.

make a custom module with a repeater.  within the repeater, have all of the bells and whistles that you want.  for each bell and whistle, add a boolean to it (set to false).  this boolean will do to things,
1: display the code on the front end
2: hide the fields on the backend when off

now that you have a repeater, you can drag and drop them within the module on the post.
but yeah, flexible column in blog posts +1
You can add Hubl to an article. So you can create sections that will allow you to export to context and reuse the hubl inside of the post.

Hi there, Im using a coded template. And I'm trying to change the default content of the module just on that one template. Here is what im doing 
```{% module "SR Hero 01" path="/sr/custom-modules/SR Hero 01", heading="Build A High-Converting HubSpot Website Without Hiring An Agency", content="Try For Free" %}```
That code works, it changes the `heading` and the `content` fields.
 
But what I cant figure out is how to change the content of a repeater, you can do this with a Drag and Drop template so it must be possible.
 
this is what I've tried 
```{% module "SR Three Col 02" path="/sr/custom-modules/SR Three Col 02", label="SR Three Col 02", heading="How Does Your Product/Service Serve Your Customer?", description="Be as specific as you can.", column=[{col_heading="Get Pro"}, {col_heading="Get Pro"}, {col_heading="Get Pro"}] %}```
trying to change the items in the `column` field. I just cant get the right syntax
